terms.definition: A systematic process of ensuring that products or services meet specified requirements and standards through testing, inspection, and documentation.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to access previous versions and see revision history.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and modifications made to a document or system, providing transparency and accountability.
A single, unified location where all documents, files, and data are stored and managed, accessible to authorized users from one platform.
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted online and accessed through web browsers.
The systematic monitoring and documentation of adherence to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and internal policies.
Pre-configured sequences of tasks and processes that execute automatically based on triggers or conditions, reducing manual intervention.
A software system designed to store, organize, track, and control electronic documents and their versions throughout their lifecycle.
An international standard that specifies requirements for quality management systems, focusing on consistent product and service delivery.
An international standard for environmental management systems that helps organizations minimize their environmental impact.
Security measures that determine who can view, edit, or manage specific documents and data within a system.
Immediate synchronization of changes across all users and systems as soon as modifications are made to documents or data.
A dedicated online platform where external vendors and suppliers can upload documents, certifications, and reports directly to the organization's system.
The process of ensuring that business operations and documentation adhere to laws, regulations, and industry standards.
The creation, storage, and management of documents in electronic format rather than physical paper, enabling better organization and accessibility.
